Following from the previous question, and using correct chemical notation, what is the empirical formula of lithium nitride?

t.t: Recall from the previous question that by losing and gaining electrons to attain noble gas electron configurations the ions we get are \mbox{Li^{+}} and \mbox{N^{3ï¿½}}. Combine them in a ratio which yields a neutral compound.

box.t: The formula is \mbox{Li}_3\mbox{N}. Three \mbox{Li^{+}} ions have a charge of +3 and one \mbox{N^{3-}} ion has a charge of -3 so the combination \mbox{\mbox{Li}_3\mbox{N}} is neutral and gives us the correct empirical formula.
